definitions.definition: A mechanical linkage based on parallelograms causing two objects to move in parallel ; notably as a drawing aid.
examples: A pantograph can be adjusted to make either scaled or exact copies.

definitions.definition: By extension, a structure of crosswise bars linked in such a way that it can extend and compress like an accordion , such as in a pantograph mirror or a scissor lift .
A pattern printed on a document to reduce the ease of photocopying.
examples: I was impressed by the quality of the pantograph ; I hadn't noticed it on the original, but the copies were covered in unpleasant lines.

definitions.definition: A similarly-formed conductive device, now usually Z-shaped, that collects electric current from overhead lines for trains and trams .

main_definition: A mechanical linkage based on parallelograms causing two objects to move in parallel ; notably as a drawing aid.
secondary_definitions: By extension, a structure of crosswise bars linked in such a way that it can extend and compress like an accordion , such as in a pantograph mirror or a scissor lift .
A pattern printed on a document to reduce the ease of photocopying.
( rail transport ) A similarly-formed conductive device, now usually Z-shaped, that collects electric current from overhead lines for trains and trams .
